src:
Penyidik KPK Panggil 2 Direktur Swasta Terkait Suap Impor Ikan
01 Nov 2019, 13:04 by Chairul Umam


Penyidik KPK Panggil 2 Direktur Swasta Terkait Suap Impor Ikan

KBRN, Jakarta : Tim Penyidik Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) hari ini memanggil dua direktur perusahaan swasta terkait kasus suap import ikan, Jumat (01/11/2019).
Keduanya adalah Direktur PT Sanjaya International Fishery, Antoni dan Direktur CV Dua Putera, Mawahib untuk tersangka mantan Direktur Utama Risyanto Suanda.
"Mereka di panggil sebagai saksi untuk tersangka RSU ( Risyanto Suanda)," ujar Juru bicara KPK Febri Diansyah.
Belum diketahui apa yang akan digali tim penyidik terhadap keduanya. Hanya saja, KPK menduga Risyanto menerima uang dari perusahaan importir lain yaitu sebesar US$30.000, 30.000 dolar Singapura, dan 50.000 dolar Singapura.
Sebelumnya, Risyanto Suanda resmi ditetapkan sebagai tersangka lantaran diduga menerima uang suap dari tersangka Direktur PT Navy Arsa Sejahtera Mujib Mustofa sebesar US$30Â ribu terkait kuota impor ikan.
KPK menemukan adanya dugaan alokasi fee Rp 1.300 untuk setiap kilogram ikan berjenis Frozen Pacific Mackarel atau ikan salem yang diimpor dari China.
Kesepakatan fee itu lantaran perusahaan Mujib telah mendapatkan kuota impor 250 ton dari Risyanto Suanda selaku direktur utama saat itu untuk melakukan impor ikan. Padahal, seharusnya yang melakukan kegiatan impor tersebut adalah Perum Perindo.
text:
KPK Investigators Call 2 Private Directors Regarding Bribery in Importing Fish
01 Nov 2019, 13:04 by Chairul Umam


KPK Investigators Call 2 Private Directors Regarding Bribery in Importing Fish

KBRN, Jakarta: The Investigation Team of the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) today summoned two directors of private companies regarding the case of bribery importing fish on Friday (01/11/2019).
Both of them are Director of PT Sanjaya International Fishery, Antoni and Director of CV Dua Putera, Mawahib for the former suspect Director Risyanto Suanda.
"They were called as witnesses to the suspect RSU (Risyanto Suanda)," said KPK spokesman Febri Diansyah.
Not yet known what the investigation team will explore the two. However, the KPK suspects that Risyanto received money from other importing companies in the amount of US $ 30,000, 30,000 Singapore dollars and 50,000 Singapore dollars.
Previously, Risyanto Suanda was officially named a suspect because he was suspected of receiving bribes from the suspect Director of PT Navy Arsa Sejahtera Mujib Mustofa in the amount of US $ 30 thousand related to the fish import quota.
The KPK found allegations of a fee allocation of Rp 1,300 for every kilogram of Frozen Pacific Mackarel or salmon fish imported from China.
The fee agreement was due to Mujib's company getting a 250-ton import quota from Risyanto Suanda as the managing director at the time to import fish. In fact, the one who should have carried out the import activity was Perum Perindo.
